title: Adding unnecessary `use libp2p;` statement leads to unrelated error when adding String to &str
body:
**I tried this code:**

```rust
use libp2p;
fn main() {
    let teststring = "hi".to_string();
    println!("{}", String::from("/") + &teststring);
}
```
Repo with code sample: https://github.com/Frederik-Baetens/libp2p-err-sample

The used crate does need to be libp2p. I haven't found any other crates with which this behavior occurs. I understand that this points to weird stuff going on in libp2p, but I think that strange behavior like this should never happen, no matter what black magic is going on in libp2p.

**I expected to see this happen:** No compiler error when running `cargo check`

**Instead, this happened:**
```
error[E0277]: cannot add `&String` to `String`
 --> src/main.rs:4:41
  |
4 |     let addedstring = String::from("/") + &teststring;
  |                                         ^ no implementation for `String + &String`
  |
  = help: the trait `Add<&String>` is not implemented for `String`
```

The error only occurs when the uneccesary use statement is present.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c
commit-date: 2021-11-29
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.57.0
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
I also tried with nightly and the bug exists there as well.

This bug also happened in the gitlab CI for the project I originally encountered this bug in.
